body_html:
I think I encountered the same issue and found a workaround.
The following errors out with a NotFoundError in the SaverV2 code:

saver.save(session, 'model')

However using a path (even a relative one) works:

saver.save(session, './model')
body_text:
I think I encountered the same issue and found a workaround.
The following errors out with a NotFoundError in the SaverV2 code:
saver.save(session, 'model')

However using a path (even a relative one) works:
saver.save(session, './model')
body:
I think I encountered the same issue and found a workaround.
The following errors out with a `NotFoundError` in the `SaverV2` code:
```
saver.save(session, 'model')
```
However using a path (even a relative one) works:
```
saver.save(session, './model')
```
